pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:0.4: 10. The training rule on renouncing the training
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.2: the nun Caṇḍakāḷī had argued with the nuns. In anger she said this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.3: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.4: The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics. There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.5: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.6: “How could the nun Caṇḍakāḷī say this in anger?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī said this in anger?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.14: “… How could the nun Caṇḍakāḷī say this in anger?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.17: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.18: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.20: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training! The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics. There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them,”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.21: then the nuns should correct her like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.22: “Venerable, don’t say such things in anger, ‘I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training! The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics. There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.’ Take delight, Venerable; the Teaching is well proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.23: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.24: If she then stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.25: If she does not stop, then after the third announcement that nun too has committed an offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.8: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training! The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics. There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.12: Other nuns who see it or hear about it. They should correct her like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.13: “Venerable, don’t say such things in anger:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.14: ‘I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.15: The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.16: There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.17: Take delight, Venerable; the Teaching is well proclaimed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.18: Practice the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.19: And they should correct her a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.21: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.22: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.23: If those who heard about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.24: That nun, even if she has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.25: “Venerable, don’t say such things in anger:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.26: ‘I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.27: The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.28: There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.29: Take delight, Venerable; the Teaching is well proclaimed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.30: Practice the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.31: They should correct her a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.33: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.34: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.36: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.37: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.38: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.39: The nun so-and-so says this in anger:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.40: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.41: The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.42: There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.43: And she keeps on saying it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.44: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should press her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.46: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.47: The nun so-and-so says this in anger:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.48: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.49: The Sakyan daughters are not the only ascetics.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.50: There are other ascetics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.51: And she keeps on saying it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.52: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.53: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.54: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.55: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.56: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.57: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.58: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.59: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.60: After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.61: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.62: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.64: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.66: there is an offense when she has been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.68: she is sent away from the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.70: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.2: if she has not been pressed;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.6: The tenth offense entailing suspension is finished.
